A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Man the crazy off the rails hate this got from regular fans and PSYCHOS with a political agenda was just weird. I really really liked what Rian did with The Last Jedi aside from a few jokes that fell flat for me\, Hux phone call for example\, this Star Wars chase film mixed with Jedi melodrama  kept me at the edge of my seat\, also a great score and great looking film that challenges what being a hero is and puts that into the forefront\, a very welcoming theme\, along with a hopeful note\, that fits a modern era Star Wars film. I really REALLY will never agree nor understand The Las Jedi detractors\, I've been a fan since my mom took me to see Empire Strikes Back 7 times summer of 1980\, and this is the most excited I've been for Star Wars in a long time post the Clone Wars series. I hope that JJ Abrams doesn't try to appease to the whiny SW fanbase and retcon all the good bits from TLJ\, it would be a shame to get another lame beat for beat rehash of Return Of The Jedi like Abrams did with The Force Awakens. 4 stars\, only the bloated running time\, could have been edited a bit more\, and some of the jokes kept me from giving The Last Jedi 5 stars.
